00044 //
00045 // One point in a curve
00046 //
00047 class EQPoint
00048 {
00049 public:
00050    EQPoint( const double f, const double d ) { Freq = f; dB = d; }
00051    double Freq;
00052    double dB;
00053 };
00054 WX_DECLARE_OBJARRAY( EQPoint, EQPointArray);
00055 
00056 //
00057 // One curve in a list
00058 //
00059 // LLL:  This "really" isn't needed as the EQPointArray could be
00060 //       attached as wxClientData to the wxChoice entries.  I
00061 //       didn't realize this until after the fact and am too
00062 //       lazy to change it.  (But, hollar if you want me to.)
00063 //
00064 class EQCurve
00065 {
00066 public:
00067    EQCurve( const wxString & name ) { Name = name; }
00068    EQCurve( const wxChar * name ) { Name = name; }
00069    wxString Name;
00070    EQPointArray points;
00071 };
00072 WX_DECLARE_OBJARRAY( EQCurve, EQCurveArray );
00073 
00074 class EffectEqualization: public Effect {
00075 
00076 public:
00077 
00078    EffectEqualization();
00079    virtual ~EffectEqualization();
00080 
00081    virtual wxString GetEffectName() {
00082       return wxString(_("Equalization..."));
00083    }
00084 
00085    virtual std::set<wxString> GetEffectCategories() {
00086       std::set<wxString> result;
00087       result.insert(wxT("http://lv2plug.in/ns/lv2core#EQPlugin"));
00088       return result;
00089    }
00090 
00091    virtual wxString GetEffectIdentifier() {
00092       return wxString(wxT("Equalization"));
00093    }
00094 
00095    virtual wxString GetEffectAction() {
00096       return wxString(_("Performing Equalization"));
00097    }
00098 
00099    virtual bool Init();
00100    virtual bool PromptUser();
00101    virtual bool DontPromptUser();
00102    virtual bool TransferParameters( Shuttle & shuttle );
00103 
00104    virtual bool Process();
00105 
00106    // Number of samples in an FFT window
00107    enum {windowSize=16384};   //MJS - work out the optimum for this at run time?  Have a dialog box for it?
00108 
00109    // Low frequency of the FFT.  20Hz is the
00110    // low range of human hearing
00111    enum {loFreqI=20};
00112 
00113 private:
00114    bool ProcessOne(int count, WaveTrack * t,
00115                    sampleCount start, sampleCount len);
00116 
00117    void Filter(sampleCount len,
00118                float *buffer);
00119    void ReadPrefs();
00120 
00121    HFFT hFFT;
00122    float *mFFTBuffer;
00123    float *mFilterFuncR;
00124    float *mFilterFuncI;
00125    int mM;
00126    wxString mCurveName;
00127    bool mLin;
00128    double mdBMax;
00129    double mdBMin;
00130    bool mDrawMode;
00131    int mInterp;
00132    bool mPrompting;
00133    bool mDrawGrid;
00134    bool mEditingBatchParams;
00135 
00136 public:
00137    enum curveType {
00138      amradio, acoustic,
00139      nab, lp, aes, deccaffrrmicro, deccaffrr78, riaa,
00140      col78, deccaffrrlp, emi78, rcavictor1938, rcavictor1947,
00141      nCurveTypes
00142    };
00143 
00144    enum {nCurvePoints=28};
00145    static const float curvex[];
00146    static const float curvey[][nCurvePoints];
00147    static const wxChar * curveNames[];
00148 
00149 friend class EqualizationDialog;
00150 friend class EqualizationPanel;
00151 };

00380    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00381    // All objects must support this property.
00382    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild( int childId, wxAccessible** child );
00383 
00384    // Gets the number of children.
00385    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int* childCount);
00386 
00387    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00388    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00389    // string if there is no action.
00390    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00391    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00392    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00393    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction( int childId, wxString *actionName );
00394 
00395    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00396    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription( int childId, wxString *description );
00397 
00398    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00399    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00400    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00401    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00402    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus( int *childId, wxAccessible **child );
00403 
00404    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00405    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText( int childId, wxString *helpText );
00406 
00407    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00408    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00409    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut( int childId, wxString *shortcut );
00410 
00411    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00412    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00413    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation( wxRect& rect, int elementId );
00414 
00415    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00416    virtual wxAccStatus GetName( int childId, wxString *name );
00417 
00418    // Returns a role constant.
00419    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole( int childId, wxAccRole *role );
00420 
00421    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00422    // of this object.
00423    // Acceptable values:
00424    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00425    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00426    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00427    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00428    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object

00430 
00431    // Returns a state constant.

00433

00435    // or child.
